thread.title: IPL auction: 2017 IPL auction: The five biggest earners - Times of India
thread.title_full: IPL auction: 2017 IPL auction: The five biggest earners - Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: IPL auction: 2017 IPL auction: The five biggest earners - Times of India
text:
NEW DELHI: The 2017 IPL players auction in Bangalore on Monday saw some frenzied bidding for overseas fast bowlers and allrounders, in particular, and at the end of the day here are the five biggest winners. 

BEN STOKES (Rs 14.5 crore, Rising Pune Supergiants) 

The England allrounder emerged the biggest purchase of the auction, going to RPS who forked out Rs 14.5 crore for his services - more than seven times his base price - to make him the costliest overseas player in IPL history and the second most overall, behind Yuvraj Singh who went to Royal Challengers Bangalore for 16 crore in 2015. 



TYMAL MILLS (Rs 12 crore, Royal Challengers Bangalore) 

The second highest earner on Monday was Stokes' England team-mate Mills, who went to RCB for Rs 12 crore in his first appearance in the auction, and from a base price of 50 lakhs, to set a record for the most expensive specialist bowler in the IPL. 

KAGISO RABADA (Rs 5 crore, Delhi Daredevils) 

The South African fast bowler fetched a hefty Rs 5 crore price tag during his maiden IPL auction , adding immense value to a Daredevils pace bowling pool that needed support for Mohammed Shami and Zaheer Khan . 

TRENT BOULT (Rs 5 crore, Kolkata Knight Riders) 

Boult had been released during the trading window, and found a very profitable deal with two-time winners KKR who needed an overseas fast bowler. In a recent T20I against South Africa, Boult achieved the best figures by a New Zealand bowler - 2/8 in four overs. 

PAT CUMMINS (Rs 4.5 crore, Delhi Daredevils) 

The former KKR fast bowler was snapped up by Delhi, who along with Rabada now have a formidable bowling attack. Cummins was one of seven marquee players with a base price of Rs 2 crore.
